CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 20, 1946, pg. 27, reads: "They'll be in Big 'Water Circus' - Here are just a few of the members who'll perform in the giantic 'Water Circus' at Ammon Center pool on the night of Aug. 9. The circus is being sponsored by the Frogs and Bureau of Recreation and directed by Pomeroyal Fountain.  He is being ably assisted by James Dorsey, director of the Ammon Center.  The cast will consist of at least fifty performers, and the entire show promises to be one of the greatest ever staged in Pittsburgh."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and men wearing bathing suits, participants in FROGS week "Water Circus," back row from left: instructor William Saay, Jackie Crawford, Eugenia Scott, Helen Crawford, unknown woman, instructor Terrance Gorman; front row: Jane Snowden Willis, Willa Francis Kelly, Catherine Muldrow, Lois Weaver Watson, Theresa Weaver, and Yvonne Hall, posed on low diving board of indoor swimming pool, Centre Avenue YMCA, another version
